Essential for understanding the authority to perform certain actions as well as the context of the information and is therefore mandatory. E.g. A 'friend' may not be able to make consent decisions, but may be able to pick up dispenses.

The element uses CWE to allow for the capture of Responsible Person Type concepts not presently supported by the approved code system(s). In this case, the human-to-human benefit of capturing additional non-coded values outweighs the penalties of capturing some information that will not be amenable to searching or categorizing.
Identifies the relative position of the location along a particular axis
Used to geographically describe the location. There is no point specifying a coordinate system without identifying the coordinates. Therefore this association is mandatory.
Allows the capturing of a physical location according to a particular coordinate system, such as GPS, legal designation (lot, block, plan), range-meridian, etc.
Some locations cannot be described by postal addresses. Also, geographic coordinates allow calculation of distances and proximity
Identifies the coordinate system inclusive of any transformation projections.
Essential for interpretting the specified coordinates and therefore mandatory
Describes the postion of the location along a specific axis.
Defines the position of the location
Identifies the individual coordinate in the coordinate system inclusive of any transformations or projections.
Examples of corordinate types are: meridian, range, township, longitude, latitude, lot, block, etc.
Acts as the "name" in the name-value pair that expresses a coordinate and is therefore mandatory
Denotes the individual coordinate value as a a physical quantity. For example, lot number, range number, latitude, etc.
Actually expresses the location along the axis. Because unknown axis positions can simply be omitted, this attribute is mandatory.
References an existing event record by identifier.
As a request, refers to the event to be acted upon or which has been acted upon.
As a response, may be used to indicate the identifier assigned to a created object.
The identifier assigned by the central system (EHR) to the Event record being referred to.
Allows the event record to be uniquely referenced and is therefore mandatory.
References an existing event record by identifier.
As a request, refers to the event to be acted upon or which has been acted upon.
As a response, may be used to indicate the identifier assigned to a created object.
The identifier assigned by the central system (EHR) to the Event record being referred to.
Allows the event record to be uniquely referenced and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the comments to be recorded against a Patient's record.
Allows comments to be attached to a Patient record. A Patient record can pertain to demographic or clinical (Drug, Condition, Lab, DI, Immunization, etc) information.
A coded value denoting the category of note being attached to a Patient's record. Categories of note include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, Immunization, etc

Allows patient notes of different purposes and use, to be attached to a patient. Attribute is mandatory to ensure that patient notes are categorized accordingly. This attribute may also be used by DISs to enforce different access control to different types of notes.
Free textual description of the patient note.

Allows a provider to attach comments to a patient as a whole or to the patient's profile (such as medication, lab. DI, etc). This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having a patient note unless there's actually content in the note.
Allows a provider to request restricted access by the patient.
Valid values are: 'N' (normal - denotes 'Not Masked'); 'R' (restricted - denotes 'Masked') and 'T' (taboo - denotes 'Patient Access Restricted').
The default is 'normal' signifying 'Not Masked'.
Taboo allows the provider to request restricted access to patient or their care giver.
Constraint: Can’t have both normal and one of the other codes simultaneously.
The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.
Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.
Root class for query definition
Indicates that the result set is to be filtered to include only those patient annotation pertaining to the specified annotation category.
Valid patient note categories include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, etc.
Allows for the retrieval of all patient notes pertaining to a specific note category.
Identifies the comments to be recorded against a Patient's record.
Allows comments to be attached to a Patient record. A Patient record can pertain to demographic or clinical (Drug, Condition, Lab, DI, etc) information.
Identifier of the patient note record.
Allows for the unique reference of a patient note and is therefore mandatory.
Allows for referencing of a particular patient note and thus allows for the removal of the note.
A coded value denoting the category of note being attached to a Patient's record. Categories of note include: General, Medication, Lab, DI, etc.

Allows patient notes of different purposes and use, to be attached to a patient. Attribute is mandatory to ensure that patient notes are categorized accordingly. This attribute may also be used by DISs to enforce different access control to different types of notes.
Free textual description of the patient note.

Allows a provider to attach comments to a patient as a whole or to the patient's profile (such as medication, lab. DI, etc). This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having a patient note unless there's actually content in the note.
Allows a provider to request restricted access by the patient.
Valid values are: 'N' (normal - denotes 'Not Masked'); 'R' (restricted - denotes 'Masked') and 'T' (taboo - denotes 'Patient Access Restricted').
The default is 'normal' signifying 'Not Masked'.
Taboo allows the provider to request restricted access to patient or their care giver.
Constraint: Can’t have both normal and one of the other codes simultaneously.
The attribute is required because even if a jurisdiction doesn't support masking on the way in, it will need to need to communicate masked data returned from other jurisdictions.
Identifier of the provider who created the patient note.
Allows other providers to communicator with the author of the note for follow-up enquiries. The author of an annotation must always be known and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the patient note was created.
Allows other provider to evaluate the currency of the information contained in the note.
The date of the note creation is always known and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the facility/location where the patient note was recorded.
Important for performing follow-up and is therefore mandatory.
Identification of the provider who was supervising the actions of the author.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
The identifier assigned by the central system (EHR) to the record item being annotated.
Allows the record to be uniquely referenced and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the comments to be recorded against a Patient's record.
Allows comments to be attached to a Patient record. A Patient record can pertain to demographic or clinical (Drug, Condition, Lab, DI, etc) information.
Free text comment to be attached to a record.

Allows a provider to attach arbitrary comments to clinical records (prescription, dispenses, lab results, allergies, etc) for communication. This attribute is mandatory because there's no point in having an annotation unless there's actually content in the note.
Indicates the particular record to which the annotation applies.
Ensures the annotation is connected to the correct record, and therefore mandatory.
Conveys information about a diagnosis to be masked
Allows masking of items related to a particular medical condition.
If code is SNOMED, value must not be specified. Otherwise value is mandatory and code must be ‘DX’
Used to indicate that this observation is a diagnosis, and for SNOMED, provides details of what the diagnosis is.
Needed to convey the diagnosis information to be masked, and attribute is therefore mandatory.
The diagnosis whose associated records should be masked.
Allows masking of all records (prescriptions, dispenses, encounters, lab tests, etc.) associated with the specified diagnosis. This element is optional because it is not used for SNOMED.
Indicates the materia (e.g drug) whose associated records should be masked.
Usually specified at the generic or therapeutic-equivalent level to ensure related medications are also covered.
Allows masking a drug, avoiding the requirement to mask each prescription and dispense individually.
A particular record or type of record for which masking is supported.
The root construct for masking and unmasking specific record or type of record.
The identifier of the prescription, dispense, allergy, lab test result or other record for which the masking status is being changed.
In many systems, masking a 'child' may result in automatic masking of the parent. For example, masking a dispense record may cause the prescription to become masked as well.
Allows unique reference to a particular record to be masked or unmasked.
Indicates a detailed type of record to be masked. E.g. All lab tests of a given type.
Allows automatic masking of a particular type of record rather than requiring each occurrence to be masked individually.
Indicates the new value for the masking status of the item.
Forces the sender of the message to assert what the new value should be, rather than performing a 'toggle' and potentially ending up in the wrong state. Therefore, the attribute is mandatory.
Identifies indications whose associated records should be masked.
Allows for automatic masking of all records associated with a particular indication diagnosis.
Information being transmitted to proviers as a 'mass broadcast'
Allows conveying information such as stolen prescription pads, system availability information, etc.
Contains the text to be displayed to the user of the system.
Allows conveying of system messages and other types of alerts. E.g. Planned outages, stolen prescription pads, etc.
The unique identifier of the policy carrier.
RxS1: OID, made up of OID root and extension that identifies the insurance carrier.
Not permitted to facilitate real time processing.
Not permitted to facilitate real time processing.

documentation.businessName: contact person telephone or email details

documentation.p: Covered Person Identifier
(Assigned by carrier - root of OID)
= Subscriber+Dependents
Can be a single covered party,
an organization, an animal
or a group of patients
and/or a group of animals.
Covered party may be a patient who for the purposes of the invoice is a covered party.

For Adjudication Results: Policy information can be returned in an EOB in adjudication results to inform a Provider of new policy information for a policy that was not submitted in the Invoice by the Provider (to be confirmed and specified in the NeCST Message Specifications).
The insurance policy identifier of the party covered.

For Invoice, Pre-Determination and Coverage Extension requests: If this information is not supplied, the Adjudicator may attempt to determine the information from other patient information supplied in the message (e.g. name, date of birth, gender) and would return this information with the response. If this cannot be obtained in a real time environment, the message may be rejected, depending on the Application Role (if Application Role = Final).
For Invoice, Pre-Determination and Coverage Extension results: This information is mandatory.
RxS1: This information is mandatory. Scheme to be confirmed.
In the absence of a Covered Party identifier, additional information to identify the individual may be required (e.g. name, date of birth).
For Invoice: In good faith Invoices, the Policy Identifier, Covered Party Identifier and Policy Holder Identifier is not present, and therefore this attribute cannot be made mandatory.

For new borns & children not registered to date such as adopted children (i.e. without a covered party identifier), the parents' policy is specified (in PolicyOrAccount.id). The new born/child is noted as the covered party.

documentation.businessName: Covered Party Relationship to Policy Holder
documentation.p: The covered party relationship to the Policy Holder.
For Invoice and Pre-Determination Request & all Results: Mandatory, otherwise Required.
Reason for being covered, including spouse, child, students, handicapped
Animal Patient
Used when invoice is for animal patient.
Name of animal
The information of the person patient.
Person Name
Name of the Patient
The gender of the patient
Administrative Gender is mandatory for Invoices without a policy identifier (e.g. WCB or Auto claim).
This would also be mandatory for active enrollment.
May not be provided based on privacy legislation, so cannot be mandatory and then NP'd b
Patient Date of Birth
RxS1: Specify as YYYYMMDD.
Patient Date of Birth + Patient Name and/or Patient Gender is used to help confirm the policy identifier.
Birth date is mandatory for Invoices without a policy identifier (e.g. WCB or Auto claim).
This would also be mandatory for active enrollment.
May not be provided based on privacy legislation, so cannot be mandatory and then NP'd by a benefit group (e.g. Rx).
Only date portion should be specified.
An indicator used to specify if the patient is part of a multiple birth, as in a twin, triplet, etc.
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
The order of birth of the patient in the situation that the patient is indicated as part of a multiple birth.
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
Valid only if MultipleBirthIndicator set to positive
The unique identifier of the billing contract information.
Alberta Health & Wellness requires an ability to message a business arrangement identifier for invoices in Alberta.
Alberta Health & Wellness requires an ability to message a business arrangement identifier for invoices in Alberta.
The type of provision made for reimbursing the healthcare services provided over a specific period. I.e. Capitation Funding or Fee For Service.
RxS1: Not permitted, as billing arrangements are not included in this scenario.
Healthcare Documents used in diagnosis, eg. x-ray.
Used to attach documents, image, etc.
required to support a health claim.
Value is not mandatory to allow for case where just a reference to an existing attachment is required.
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the Attachment.
RxS1: Not permitted, as attachments are not included in this scenario
The type of attachment. I.e.. Health document type, image type.
Domain has not been defined for attachment types. RxS1: Not permitted, as attachments are not included in this scenario.

The content of the attachment that is intended either for human interpretation or further machine processing. i.e. The image. This includes unformatted or formatted written language, multimedia data, or structured information in as defined by a different standard i.e.. Health document content. Instead of the attachment content this may contain only a reference to the information that may be located inline or remote.
RxS1: Not permitted, as attachments are not included in this scenario.
To reference a previously submitted attachment, only require the identifier of the attachment

This allows for an Invoice Grouping to be composed of one or more invoice element groups and/or details. There must be one leaf detail.Sequence number used to sequence invoice elements in an Invoice Grouping and will not be included in Adjudication Results.
At most 5 levels of recursion, with “n” children at each level. Root level counts as level 1.
The number of children for each group cannot and should not be limited.
At most 5 levels of recursion, with “n” children at each level. Root level counts as level 1.
Only 1 policy can be specified for authorizations & coverage extentionsFor groups, specify all policies (e.g. WCB claim numbers) with the same coverage.sequenceNumber.

Refers to multiple policies for an Invoice Grouping. The Invoice Grouping could refer to a single patient or multiple patients. For Pharmacy invoices, only supply policies for the Adjudicator that is the recipient of the Invoice. Other policies that may be applied against an Invoice Grouping, that will not be adjudicatd by the Adjudicator, will not be included with the Invoice. In other words, you would not disclose policies for which the Adjudicator is not going to adjudicate against.

If the Provider is aware of multiple policies that the Adjudicator adjudicates against, then they may, at their discretion, indicate both policies in the same Invoice. The Adjudicator must respond to all policies in the Invoice for which they adjudicate. This would allow the Adjudicator to resolve COB priority if multiple policies are noted on the Invoice.
Expectation is that Adjudicator must support multiple policies, but Provider could send 1 Invoice with multiple policies or send multiple Invoices with 1 policy each.
This relationship is mandatory for the Root Invoice Element Group and is not permitted for all other Invoice Element Groups.
Unique identifier used for cross-referrence.
Identifier required to link invoices.
Includes references to authorization, coverage extension and pre-determination results. Previous adjudication results are not referenced with this mechanism
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.

Includes references to authorization, coverage extension and pre-determination results. The identifier is the Root Adjudicated Invoice Element Group ID, returned on the previous authorization, coverage extension or pre-determination results.

In some situations, the authorization, coverage extension and pre-determination number may not be available to the submitter electronically. Therefore, the OID root may not be available. Current action item raised to determine if the OID root can be optional for this situation.
Previous adjudication results are not referenced with this mechanism
May also be used for other identifiers that have been assigned by external agencies through a manual process, that if supplied on an Invoice, would result in payment.
The details of the Invoice item billed for, as in the product or service.
RTO used to specify 15 pills (each) out of a bottle of 100 pills (each) to reflect billing for a portion of a package (e.g. 0.15 of a bottle)
Domain for InvoiceElementDetail.code is GenericBillableItemModifier
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the Invoice Line item.
OID (object identifier) + unique number generated by the pharmacy software for the specific invoice element detail.

The identifier will be the same as its parent Invoice Element Group, appended with a ".x", where "x" is a number siginifying the occurence of this item under its parent. For example, the parent id is "12942" and this is the 2nd item under the parent. Therefore, the id for this item would be "12942.2".
Must not be the same identifier as the PaymentRequest.id or the InvoiceElementGroup.id.
Only one identifier for an Invoice Detail is allowed.

Product/Service Code e.g. Office Visit ,Taxes, Markup, Dispense + Product/Service Code Modifier e.g. northern isolation, off hours, specialty, on call. Also allows for specification of equivalents for each code for each Payor

For Adjudication Results: each Invoice Element Group or Detail that has been submitted must have a corresponding response with the same Invoice Element code. There may be additional Invoice Elements in the adjudication results for situations like code substitution.
Modifiers for the codes are taken from the same domain (i.e ActPoductServiceBillableItemCode).

Codes for this domain include intervention/procedure codes (e.g. CCI), product codes (e.g. HCPCS), pharmacy product codes (e.g. DIN). The code set also includes generic codes, applicable to all benefit groups, for specification of taxes, surcharges and discounts.
There are specific rules, by code set, for specification of these codes (e.g. CCI codes are stripped of punctuation).
There are specific rules, by code set, for specification of these codes (e.g. CCI codes are stripped of punctuation).
RxS1: Select one of MARKUP (markup), PROFFEE (professional fee), or <DIN>/<GTIN>/<UPC> (drug), depending on what invoice element detail is being described.
A description of the number of instances of a product or service. I.e.. 4 hours, 4 mg, 4 boxes, 15 each of a container of 1000 each
RxS1: For the <DIN>/<GTIN>/<UPC> invoice element detail, specifiy as "x" over "y" with no units of measure, where "x" is the number of pills and "y" is the package size. E.g. "10" over "100".
RxS1: For the MARKUP, PROFFEE invoice element details, specify as 1 over 1. E.g. "1" over "1".
Field length for value (value) may include a decimal point (e.g. 3.5 hours) with no restriction on the number of digits past the decimal point.
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
Unit of measure for "each" is left null.
Example: <numerator value="10" unit="MG"/> <denominator value="100" unit="MG"/>
The monetary cost per unit of the product or service. I.e.. $0.20/mg, $250/day, $50
RxS1: For the <DIN>/<GTIN>/<UPC> invoice element detail, specifiy as "x" dollars over (per) "1" pill, with no units of measure. E.g. "5.00" "CAD" over (per) "1".
RxS1: For the MARKUP, PROFFEE invoice element details, specify as "x" dollars over (per) "1" unit, with no units of measure. E.g. "12.00" "CAD" over (per) "1"
Field length for value (amount) includes a decimal point. Decimal point MUST be specified with 2 and only 2 digits of precision. Example: "150.12".
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
Units for denominator must be the same as the units for the denominator of UnitPriceAmt. Value for denominator must be 1.
Example: <numerator value="500.00" currency="CAD"/> <denominator value="1" unit="MG"/>
The amount billed for the Invoice Line product or service. This is the result of Submitted Unit Quantity * Submitted Unit Amount Price.
RxS1: For the <DIN>/<GTIN>/<UPC> invoice element detail, specifiy as "x" dollars. E.g. "50.00" "CAD".
RxS1: For the MARKUP, PROFFEE invoice element details, specify as "x" dollars. E.g. "12.00" "CAD"
Derived as numerator of UnitQuantity * UnitPriceAmt.
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
Field length for value (amount) includes a decimal point. Decimal point MUST be specified with 2 and only 2 digits of precision. Example: "150.12".
Example: <netAmt value="5000.00" currency="CAD"/>
Tax percentage applied to unitPriceAmt
RxS1: Not permitted, as taxes are not included in this scenario.
Factor numbers are used for taxes. They represent the percentage of tax applied to unitPriceAmt.

The statement and justification of the Total Billed Amount. For an invoice it is the statement and justification of the Total Billed amount requesting the determination of the amount owed by the payor for the service(s) that either have occurred or are on-going. For an authorization it represents the statement and justification of an invoice for a future service requesting the determination of the amount owed that is guaranteed by the payor. For a pre-determination, it represents the statement and possible justification for an invoice for a future service to determine the possible amount owed by the payor.

There are some situations where all items for a patient need to be included in 1 Invoice Grouping, as the final determination (adjudication results) will not be made until all invoice elements are considered for that patient.
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the Invoice Grouping.
OID (object identifier) + unique number generated by the pharmacy software for the specific invoice element group.

For child Invoice Element Groups, the identifier will be the same as its parent Invoice Element Group, appended with a ".x", where "x" is a number siginifying the occurence of this item under its parent. For example, the parent id is "12942" and this is the 2nd item under the parent. Therefore, the id for this item would be "12942.2".
Must not be the same identifier as the PaymentRequest.id or the InvoiceElementDetail.id.
For example:
1. unique invoice group identifier, independent of adjudicator recipient.
2. sequential invoice grouping identifier by adjudicator.
Obligation on adjudicator is to return and communicate about this item with all identifiers (i.e. identifier 1. and 2.).
Invoice Type e.g. Healthcare Services, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound, Healthcare Goods, Preferred Accomodation
This is used to indicate the type of Invoice Grouping.
Each Invoice Type is used to specify 1. vocabulary, 2. structure of the Invoice Element Choice and 3. which Billable Act(s) can be included for the specified Invoice Type.
Information on constraints for the Invoice Type will be found in the NeCST Message Specifications. Each Benefit Group will indicate which Invoice Types will be supported by that Benefit Group.
Invoice Types will not generate unique and distinct XML schemas that can tested independent of each other. They must be tested together within an Message Type.

Invoice Type is the indication to the payor as to the content rules to apply when processing and adjudicating the invoice. Basically, the structure of the invoice grouping. Ie. Clinical Product, Clinical Service, Preferred Accom, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound
RXDINV, RXCINV, CSINV, CPINV, CSPINV only for root invoice element group. RXDINV only for root invoice element group. DRGING for specify drug group.
The period of time that the invoice pertains to. This may be a specific date or a date range (as in the month of January) for the invoice.
This may be useful for nursing homes. For example, they get paid so much $ per patient per month and would need to specify the time period for the invoice.
Transmission of this information suggests a transfer of liability for how this information/invoice is used/communicated.
Legislation and service level agreements typically cover the requirement to send this code with every invoice.
This will be required for Alberta physician invoices only.
Identifies the total monetary amount billed for the invoice element. This is the sum of the Submitted Invoice Line amounts.
For Coverage Extension Results: Some adjudicators will indicate a dollar amount allowed for the coverage extension.
RxS1: Sum of InvoiceElementDetail.netAmt for all immediate child invoice elements. The root invoice element group will be the transaction total (invoice total).
For Cancel Request: This would serve as a cross-check for the Adjudicator for the Invoice Grouping that is being cancelled.
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
Could be used to attach a Limited Use Form or a Consent Form.
Use of attachments must be pre-approved by the NeCST Pharmacy SIG.
RxS1: Not permitted, as attachments are not included in this scenario.
If this relationship is required, it may only be specified for the Root Invoice Element Group and is not permitted for all other Invoice Element Groups.

Look into what HL7 is currently doing, as well as timing. Each SIG to revisit based on HL7's work. Want the ability to send attachments with the invoice as well as sending it upon request. Need to ensure that the vocab in the info codes for inv adj response supports the needed attachments.
The information about the billing contract for the invoice element.
Can be used to indicate FFS (fee for service) or CAP (capitation).
RxS1: Not permitted, as billing arrangements are not included in this scenario.
If this relationship is required, it may only be specified for the Root Invoice Element Group and is not permitted for all other Invoice Element Groups.
The reason or rationale for an Invoice Element override.
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
Some overrides will require a text note component to fully explain the override.

If an adjudicator does not support the override (e.g. repeated service), the override code should not be ignored. In other words, the Invoice Grouping will likely be refused with a message "we don't support this type of override".

Coded responses that may occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice at a summary level and provides guidance on interpretation of the referenced adjudication results. i.e.. Subscriber Coverage Problem, Good Faith Indicator, Late Invoice
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
This can be used for Xray to follow, paper to follow, etc.
The clinical information to support the invoice. The content of the Billable Act is benefit group specific.
This is where each benefit group
will insert their billable act (e.g. Pharmacy
Dispense Billable Act). Each Billable Act is
a CMET, contained in the A_Billable CMET.
Refer to the CMET for more information.
The act will be in intent (INT) mood when requesting authorization
The information about Parent or Guardian
Name of Parent or Guardian
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
The parent or guardian information of the patient.
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.

Guardian or Parent of new born. For example, use by FNIHB, as the newborn child under 1 is assumed to be a covered party under the policy. This would allow the specification of guardian, as this is not a familial relationship.
Guardian information is typically noted at time of claim enrollment (registration) and therefore may not be required on an invoice by invoice basis.

documentation.businessName: Parent or Guardian Relationship to patient
documentation.p: The relationship of the parent or the guardian to the Patient. I.e.. Father, Mother, Aunt
The allowable values are PRN (parent), MTH (mother) and FTH (father).
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario.
Set of Identifiers that uniquely identify the Invoice. Could reference an Invoice Number with associated indentifers
Details of the claim for which payment is being requested.
Set of Identifiers that uniquely identify the Invoice. Could reference an Invoice Number with associated indentifers

Invoice Identifier: Used for management of payment request objects by adjudicators to help with traceability of messages to their applications. This does not need to be surfaced to the provider. Can also be used to detect duplicate invoices.
There are some situations where more than 1 identifier for this object can be included in a message.
For example:
1. unique invoice identifier, independent of adjudicator recipient.
2. sequential invoice identifier by adjudicator.
Obligation on adjudicator is to return and communicate about this item with all identifiers (i.e. identifier 1. and 2.). At present, there are no messages where this occurs (Jun 04)
OID (object identifier) + unique number generated by the pharmacy software for the complete invoice.
Must not be the same identifier as the InvoiceElementGroup.id.
Invoice Recipient Contact person
If specified for the Payor contact, will always result in manual review by said individual - use with caution.
For Pharmacy dispense Invoices (RXDINV, RXCINV), this is NOT permitted to facilitate real-time processing.
For Pharmacy clinical product (CPINV) and clinical services (CSINV) Invoices, this is permitted to indicate who the Invoice is directed to with the Adjudicator, likely for manual review.
Payee Information (e.g. Pharmacy, head office, patient, patient agent).
For shadow billing (information invoice), a Payee may not be required. Store is noted as the PayeeRole.id in the Payee CMET.
Always specify Payee (e.g. Pharmacy, head office, patient, patient agent).
The reason or rationale for the invoice.
For Pharmacy dispense Invoices (RXDINV, RXCINV), only 1 Invoice Grouping is permitted to facilitate real-time processing.
For Pharmacy clinical product (CPINV) and clinical services (CSINV) Invoices, 1 or more Invoice Groupings are permitted.
For Coverage Extension Requests, only 1 Invoice Grouping per Payment Request.
RxS1: Only allow 1 Invoice Grouping. Maximum cardinality is 1.
For Cancel Request: To cancel an Invoice with more than 1 Invoice Grouping, each individual Invoice Group must be cancelled separately using an individual Cancel Invoice Request message.
For Cancel Results: Must include a Payment Request and Invoice Element Group.
The covered party(s) of the insurance policy of whom the product or service occurs, but is not necessarily present in the service. The party(s) that derives benefits from the act.
RxS1: Must include covered party as patient.
On an invoice, there must be a Covered Party specified against an insurance policy.
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the policy. I.e. WCB Number, Auto Number, Certificate Number, combined identifier (Group+Section+Coverage Number)
id: = Coverage Identifier, extension = Policy.Plan.Group.Contract. Division.Section.Version (or similar). Carrier noted in author participation, and may not be same namespace as OID of id
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the policy. I.e. WCB Number, Auto Number, Certificate Number, combined identifier (Group+Section+Coverage Number)

For Invoice, Pre-Determination and Coverage Extension requests: If this information is not supplied, the Adjudicator may attempt to determine the information from other patient information supplied in the message (e.g. name, date of birth, gender) and would return this information with the response. If this cannot be obtained in a real time environment, the message may be rejected, depending on the Application Role (if Application Role = Final).
For Invoice, Pre-Determination and Coverage Extension results: This information is mandatory.
RxS1: This information is mandatory. Scheme to be confirmed.

In some cases, the policy identifier may include a concatenation of group, section, certificate, etc. to be unique. Methods for specifying the Extension component of the data type will be expressed in the NeCST Message Specifications.

For Worker's Compensation and Auto Invoices, the policy identifier (WCB or Auto Claim Number) may not be known when the Invoice is submitted. In these situations, the Adjudicator may require name, address and date of accident (for example) in the Invoice to help determine the WCB or Auto Claim Number (policy identifier). Most of these adjudicators will keep this Invoice Grouping pended until the WCB or Auto Claim Number (policy identifier) is found and may be refused after a specified time period (e.g. 10 days).
For Invoice: In good faith Invoices, the Policy Identifier, Covered Party Identifier and Policy Holder Identifier is not present, and therefore this attribute cannot be made mandatory.
The identifier information of the carrier that underwrites or accepts fiscal responsibility for the insurance plan.
Values must reflect submitted values from the Provider when this information is echoed back from a Payor to the Provider.
Tax Account No. of Provider eg. GST, PST
Can be used to specify the appropriate GST number and other tax numbers.
Include 0, 1 or more EOBs from upstream adjudicators for COB Invoices to downstream Adjudicators
RxS1: Not permitted for this scenario
An upper limit has been specified to allow testers to test upper limits.

For Cancel Results: Invoice Groupings cannot be cancelled once they have been adjudicated (for the BCE Pilot). Therefore, there is no financial impact (i.e. reverse out any payment intent) and the remaining portion of the Cancel Results message is not necessary.
If this relationship is required, it may only be specified for the Root Invoice Element Group and is not permitted for all other Invoice Element Groups.
Information about the patient's consent.
Patient Keyword
The keyword used by the Patient to indicate signature or consent.
A collection of results for invoice elements adjudicated as a group.
Id of adjudicated Results Group
For Payment Advice Summary: can be used to request additional detail with a Payment Advice Query message.
For Payment Advice Summary: can be used to request additional detail with a Payment Advice Query message.
This code describes the breakdown of the financial activity.
For Payment Advice: For Vision Care payment advices, RETRO adjustments will always include references to the EOBs that made up the retroactive adjustment.

For Payment Advice: For Pharmacy payment advices, RETRO adjustments will not include references to the EOBs that made up the retroactive adjustment. Providers must submit a Payment Advice Query message to get the EOBs referenced by the RETRO amount. The Payment Advice Detail message, however, is not currently supported in Pharmacy.
For Payment Advice: Code also specifies the type of adjustment for a payment advice (e.g. CFWD - carry forward adjustment).
Time period for the payment or summary period.
For Payment Advice: Can also indicate time period over which the clawback and/or retro adjustment applies.
For Payment Advice: Can also indicate time period over which the clawback and/or retro adjustment applies.
Grand total of all SOFA observations contained in this summary - Daily Total
In this situation, it should equal the net effect of all AdjudResultsGroupSummaryData elements that would appear in the Payment Advice.

On SOFA Summary, this could be used to specify the amount that will be included in the Payment Advice. In this situation, it should equal the net effect of all AdjudResultsGroupSummaryData elements that would appear in the Payment Advice.
Summary details of the adjudicated results for this group
Used for SOFA queries only
Constrain Value to PQ or MO data types only
Identify the different types of summary information.
Summary Total
Data type can be PQ or MO only.
Running Totals. Applies to the root AdjudicatedInvoiceElementGroup only.
For Pharmacy Adjudication Results, running totals are Mandatory. For query results, this is not permitted
Adjudicator Information
Mandatory for Root AdjudicatedInvoiceElementGroup, otherwise not specified.
Mandatory for Root AdjudicatedInvoiceElementGroup, otherwise not specified.
Adjudication date/time
Used in RX for daily totals.
Used in Pharmacy for daily totals.
For Invoice (COB): Will only be valued for electronic EOBs.
Allows Payor to adj & pay on different policy

For Adjudication Results: On net new policies (i.e. adjudicated policies for which the provider did not request adjudication on the Invoice), any policy holder information will be communicated to the provider with adjudication information codes. A required action could be used to instruct the provider s/w to communicate this information to the patient.
Coverage must be specified for Root Adjudicated Invoice Element Group and may not be specified for any other Adjudicated Invoice Element Group.
The Coordination of Benefits order of the insurance policy as determined by the adjudicator.
Levels of nesting cannot be specified, as the maximum cardinality only applies to immediate children of this act, not the levels of nesting.
Note: Levels of nesting cannot be specified, as the maximum cardinality only applies to immediate children of this act, not the levels of nesting.
At most 5 levels of recursion, with “n” children at each level. Root level counts as level 1.
The details of the invoice element / line item adjudicated.
Domain for AdjudicatedInvoiceElementDetail.code is GenericBillableItemModifier
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the invoice element adjudicated.

- For Invoice (COB): An idenitifier may need to be generated by the submitting application in the situation where previous adjudication results are received manually or do not match the level of detail required for the downstream adjudicator.

For Invoice (COB): An idenitifier may need to be generated by the submitting application in the situation where previous adjudication results are received manually or do not match the level of detail required for the downstream adjudicator.

The monetary cost per unit of the product or service. I.e.. $0.20/mg, $250/day, $50

Grouping of invoice elements or line items.

RXDINV, RXCINV, CSINV, CPINV only.
Status of the Adjudicated Invoice
For Pharmacy dispense Invoices & Pre-Determinations (RXDINV, RXCINV), only completed EOBs are permitted to facilitate real-time processing.
For Pharmacy clinical product (CPINV) and clinical service (CSINV) Invoices & Pre-Determinations, status may be active, suspended or complete.

For all Coverage Extension Requests, status may be active, suspended or complete. For Invoice (COB): Status code must be complete in order for EOB to be sent to downstream Adjudicators. If a Provider receives a non-complete EOB, this cannot be forwarded to a downstream Adjudicator.
Field cannot be made mandatory, as it is not included in Payment Advice Detail messages (only completed EOBs can be included in a Payment Advice).

Active EOBs are used to convey interim or preliminary adjudication results. They can also be used, with information codes, to indicate that the invoice grouping is held for manual review by the adjudicator, waiting for other third party information (e.g. from another provider, employer, etc.).
Suspended EOBs are used to convey adjudication results that are awaiting additional information from the submitting Provider.
Complete EOBs are used to convey final adjudication results, with an associated intent to pay.
Paid Amount
For Coverage Extension Results, this is typically not specified, as dollar limits are noted as information codes.

For Pharmacy Invoices, unsolicited re-adjudication results (e.g. next day audit) for previously complete adjudication results will not be supported as it has COB impacts and financial impacts to the Pharmacy & patient.
Used for re-adjudicated Invoices (next day audit).
The following method is supported:
-> 2 new EOBs, the first with the new net effect, using the predecessor act relationship to indicate the reversal (nullification) of the original EOB.
The following method is NOT supported:
-> 1 new EOB with the net effect only.

Payment Advices cannot be used to restate an EOB for retro adjustments. The Payment Advice can only reference an existing EOB. If the Adjudicator needs to restate the EOB, they must use the Invoice Re-Adjudication Results interaction (Invoice Adjudication Results message), with the Predecessor relationship.
Target act can only include target act attributes with no target act associations
Specific adjudication observations will be added here, such as Drug Contraindications.
Will be used for DUR reporting
Result of Adjudication
For Adjudication Results: Can be any code from the ActAdjudicationCode domain.

For Invoice (COB): AS (Adjudicated As Submitted) and ANF (Adjudicated with No Financial Impact) is not usually allowed, as this would imply that the previous Adjudicator has provided an intention to pay ALL of the Invoice and therefore, an Invoice to a downstream Adjudicator is not necessary. However, if there is still an outstanding balance the EOB from an upstream Adjudicator may be sent to a downstream Adjudicator. For Adjudication Results: Can be any code from the ActAdjudicationCode domain.
Domain is ActAdjudicationInformationCode.

For Adjudication Results: Policy information can be returned in an EOB in adjudication results to inform a Provider of new policy information for a policy that was not submitted in the Invoice by the Provider (to be confirmed and specified in the NeCST Message Specifications).

Covered Party Identifier- The For Invoice, Pre-Determination and Coverage Extension requests: If this information is not supplied, the Adjudicator may attempt to determine the information from other patient information supplied in the message (e.g. name, date of birth, gender) and would return this information with the response. If this cannot be obtained in a real time environment, the message may be rejected, depending on the Application Role (if Application Role = Final).

For new borns & children not registered to date such as adopted children (i.e. without a covered party identifier), the parents' policy is specified (in PolicyOrAccount.id). The new born/child is noted as the covered party.
Relationship to Policy Holder - The covered party relationship to the Policy Holder.

The identifier will be the same as its parent Invoice Element Group, appended with a ".x", where "x" is a number siginifying the occurence of this item under its parent. For example, the parent id is "12942" and this is the 2nd item under the parent. Therefore, the id for this item would be "12942.2".

Product/Service Code, e.g. Office Visit ,Taxes, Markup, Dispense. Modifier e.g. northern isolation,off hours specialty, on call.

For Adjudication Results: each Invoice Element Group or Detail that has been submitted must have a corresponding response with the same Invoice Element code. There may be additional Invoice Elements in the adjudication results for situations like code substitution.
Modifiers for the codes are taken from the same domain (i.e ActPoductServiceBillableItemCode).

Codes for this domain include intervention/procedure codes (e.g. CCI), product codes (e.g. HCPCS), pharmacy product codes (e.g. DIN). The code set also includes generic codes, applicable to all benefit groups, for specification of taxes, surcharges and discounts.
There are specific rules, by code set, for specification of these codes (e.g. CCI codes are stripped of punctuation).
The amount billed for the Invoice Line product or service. This is the result of Submitted Unit Quantity * Submitted Unit Amount Price.

RxS1: For the MARKUP, PROFFEE invoice element details, specify as "x" dollars. E.g. "12.00" "CAD"

1. unique invoice group identifier, independent of adjudicator recipient.
2. sequential invoice grouping identifier by adjudicator.
Obligation on adjudicator is to return and communicate about this item with all identifiers (i.e. identifier 1. and 2.).
There are some situations where more than 1 identifier for this object can be included in a message.
Invoice Type e.g. Healthcare Services, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound, Healthcare Goods, Preferred Accomodation
Each Invoice Type is used to specify 1. vocabulary, 2. structure of the Invoice Element Choice and 3. which Billable Act(s) can be included for the specified Invoice Type.
Information on constraints for the Invoice Type will be found in the NeCST Message Specifications. Each Benefit Group will indicate which Invoice Types will be supported by that Benefit Group.
Invoice Types will not generate unique and distinct XML schemas that can tested independent of each other. They must be tested together within an Message Type.
Invoice sub-total - This is the sum of the Submitted Invoice Line amounts; Identifies the total monetary amount billed for the invoice element.
For Cancel Request: This would serve as a cross-check for the Adjudicator for the Invoice Grouping that is being cancelled.
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
Group of results for line items/invoice elements previously adjudicated.
Payor must be specified for the root Act ONLY. Payee is optional, but may only be specified for the root Act.
This code describes the breakdown of the financial activity and defines the 'categorization; Only really relevant for summaries.
For Payment Advice: For Vision Care payment advices, RETRO adjustments will always include references to the EOBs that made up the retroactive adjustment.

For Payment Advice: For Pharmacy payment advices, RETRO adjustments will not include references to the EOBs that made up the retroactive adjustment. Providers must submit a Payment Advice Query message to get the EOBs referenced by the RETRO amount. The Payment Advice Detail message, however, is not currently supported in Pharmacy.
For Payment Advice: Code also specifies the type of adjustment for a payment advice (e.g. CFWD - carry forward adjustment).
Time period for the payment or summary period.
For Payment Advice: Can also indicate time period over which the clawback and/or retro adjustment applies.
Summary Period Amt - Grand total of all SOFA observations contained in this summary

On SOFA Summary, this could be used to specify the amount that will be included in the Payment Advice. In this situation, it should equal the net effect of all AdjudResultsGroupSummaryData elements that would appear in the Payment Advice.
Summarised Details of the Adjudicated Results for a group of Invoice elements/line items.
Constrain Value to PQ or MO data types only
Summary Period Amt
(defines the 'categorization'. Only really relevant for summaries.
Summary Total Amt
PQ or MO only - Value of summary
Group of Invoice Elements being referenced; ie. group of billable items.
Adjudication Result Id - Technique to identify that the EOB was not electronic (manual) is through the participation mode code for the adjudicator.
May include data centre and sequence numbers
Invoice Type e.g. Healthcare Services, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound
For Invoice (COB) : Invoice type (for root) cannot be different from submitted invoice. This would be a cause for rejecting the invoice.
For Adjudication Results: code must match to the corresponding invoice element that was submitted.
For Invoice Nullify Results: this is the identifier of the EOB that was previously messaged to the Provider.
Modifiers for the codes are taken from the same domain (i.e ActInvoiceGroupCode).
Invoice Status - Completed when done, Suspended if waiting for external information, Active if delayed by Adjudicator

Active EOBs are used to convey interim or preliminary adjudication results. They can also be used, with information codes, to indicate that the invoice grouping is held for manual review by the adjudicator, waiting for other third party information (e.g. from another provider, employer, etc.).
Suspended EOBs are used to convey adjudication results that are awaiting additional information from the submitting Provider.
Complete EOBs are used to convey final adjudication results, with an associated intent to pay.

For Invoice (COB): Status code must be complete in order for EOB to be sent to downstream Adjudicators. If a Provider receives a non-complete EOB, this cannot be forwarded to a downstream Adjudicator.
Field cannot be made mandatory, as it is not included in Payment Advice Detail messages (only completed EOBs can be included in a Payment Advice).
Paid Amount
For Coverage Extension Results, this is typically not specified, as dollar limits are noted as information codes
Set of identifiers that uniquely identify the Invoice Grouping.
May include data centre and sequence numbers
1. unique invoice group identifier, independent of adjudicator recipient.
2. sequential invoice grouping identifier by adjudicator.
Obligation on adjudicator is to return and communicate about this item with all identifiers (i.e. identifier 1. and 2.).
Invoice Grouping Identifier: There are some situations where more than 1 identifier for this object can be included in a message.
Invoice Type - Health Care Services/Goods, Rx Dispense, Rx compound, Preferred Accom.

Invoice Type is the indication to the payor as to the content rules to apply when processing and adjudicating the invoice. Basically, the structure of the invoice grouping. Ie. Clinical Product, Clinical Service, Preferred Accom, Rx Dispense, Rx Compound
This is used to indicate the type of Invoice Grouping.
Each Invoice Type is used to specify 1. vocabulary, 2. structure of the Invoice Element Choice and 3. which Billable Act(s) can be included for the specified Invoice Type.
Information on constraints for the Invoice Type will be found in the NeCST Message Specifications. Each Benefit Group will indicate which Invoice Types will be supported by that Benefit Group.
Invoice Types will not generate unique and distinct XML schemas that can tested independent of each other. They must be tested together within an Message Type.
Invoice Sub-total - Identifies the total monetary amount billed for the invoice element.
For Cancel Request: This would serve as a cross-check for the Adjudicator for the Invoice Grouping that is being cancelled.
Attribute cannot be mandatory as it may not be present for a Coverage Extension Request.
This is the sum of the Submitted Invoice Line amounts.
If an Adjudicator adjudicates for multiple insurance policies (EOBs) for multiple Payors and/or Payees, there would be more than 1 Payment Intent payload in the Results message
Net_amt must be positive or 0 for
Adjudication Results messages
Net_amt must be negative or 0 for Invoice Cancel messages
Parment Intent Date/Time - Time payor intends to make payment (e.g. date of cheque/EFT run).
For nullify, this would also be the date the payor intends to make the payment.
For Invoice Nullify Results: Effective time of the cancel is noted in the control act wrapper.
payment amount
Adjudication Results: The payment intent amount cannot be mandatory for active adjudication results.
For Invoice Nullify Results: the payment intent is completed only, and therefore the amount must be specified.
For completed Payment Intents, this field is mandatory.
Organisation/Individual receiving payment for claim.
Mandatory for completed EOBs. May not be present for active/suspended EOBs
Allow walking from AdjudicatedInvoiceElementGroup to PaymentIntent for Nullify Invoice Results only
Required for Invoice Grouping Nullifys if the Invoice has already been adjudicated. A new PaymentIntent & new EOB will be created to indicate the net effect of the nullify (reversal).
To tie 2 EOBs together (e.g. ESA invoices) and for Invoice Nullify Results to point to previous EOBs.
Target act can only include target act attributes with no target act associations

packageLocation.name: MCAI_MT700210CA
packageLocation.desc: Event Request Wrapper - Human Initiated Patient Specific With Clinical Act Payload

documentation.p: Indicates the person responsible for the event that caused this message.
Choice of Patient CMET is as follows:
1. 'identified' when supporting Patient Session Tokens.
2. 'informational' when passing through non Client- Registry patient for PHS or similar processing.
3. 'identified-confirmable' otherwise.
Critical for auditing and for validating permissions and therefore mandatory.
Value should always be AUT

The time the person responsible for the event made the decision for it to occur. This may be different than the time the change became effective. (E.g. If a provider decides today to put a prescription on hold starting next Tuesday, the time of creation would be today and the change effective period would be next Tuesday.)
This date can be back-dated.
The time a change is made is a critical piece of audit information and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates how the person who recorded the event became aware of it.. E.g. Verbal, written, fax, etc.
May have ramifications for the audit trail and reliability of the information.
Indicates the formal digital signature of the message content.
Digital signatures may be needed for authentication of message content. The attribute is marked as optional because it is not yet clear whether there is a use-case for this, or where it will be used.

This is a messaging artifact used by HL7 to allow the time, signiture and method to be captured when the author is not sent. This will happen in circumstances where the author information is sent as part of the authentication token.
Conveys an authentication token associated with the event.
The token may represent one or all of the following concepts: author, dataEnterer, responsibleParty, location and dataEntryLocation.
Conveys information related to the individuals and/or locations involved with the action in situations where the authentication happens on a one-time basis rather than on a per-message basis.
An authorization token expressed as a GUID.
The Authorization token may represent the concepts of author, data enterer, supervisor (responsible party), responsible location and/or data entry location.
GUIDs are an effective way of conveying a temporary authentication token
An authentication token expressed as a non-GUID string.
The Authorization token may represent the concepts of author, data enterer, supervisor (responsible party), responsible location and/or data entry location.
Some systems may choose to use a hashcode or other approach to token construction.
A care composition is a record, which summarizes the events that happened during care including who is responsible for the care provided.
Examples include encounters, health condition (episode)-based collections and general care-based collections such as "gynecological care".
Allows linking records to encounters, condition and care-based compositions. Useful for searching and navigation of the patient's record.
Identifies the action that resulted in this message being sent.
There may be constraints on the usage of the effectiveTime and reasonCode attributes in the definition of the interaction or the trigger events which are conveyed with this wrapper.
Key to understanding what action a message represents.
A unique identifier for this particular event assigned by the system in which the event occurred.
Identifier needs to be persisted by receiving applications, except for queries (queries cannot be retracted or undone).
Allows the event to be referenced (for undos) and also indicates whether multiple interactions were caused by the same triggering event. Also used for audit purposes.
Identifies the trigger event that occurred.
This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.
Describes the status of the control act, which is always complete (it happened).
Required for completeness of specification.
Indicates the time the event (e.g. query, change, activation) should begin and occasionally when it should end.

The time an event becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded (i.e. it may be in the future or the past). For events such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.
Identifies why this specific message interaction (e.g. query, activation request, modification request) occurred.
The domain associated with this attribute will vary for each interaction and will be noted as part of the interaction description.
Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold' or 'reason for accessing information'.

Indicates the person responsible for entering the query into the system. Used when different from the person responsible for the request (author). For example, physician requests administrative assistant to print off a patient's medication profile.
This should only be specified if different from the author.
Important for audit information and determining permissions.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Indicates the location where the record of this event was entered.
This should only be specified if different from the location where the event was authored.
Indicates a potential location for written records, and may also be important for authentication purposes.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Indicates the service delivery location where the event occurred.
Indicates where paper records may be located, and may be important to determining authorization.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Identifies the authentication token that references information about the people and/or places responsible for the event.
Some systems perform centralized authentication of providers and/or locations. The association is optional because not all systems will make use of a token-based authentication process.

Associated patient record for which this message applies. Record target can be one of either identified patient (id, name, gender, date of birth), indeterminate patient (name, gender, date of birth) or a patient token (suggesting client identity).

Inferring patient identity opens up the potential for privacy breach through the mis-keying of identifiers. Also, inclusion of patient identity simplifies logging, processing and application of data access constraints such as masking and consent. Finally, patient id is required to support both EHR Index (record and update) and Patient Profile Summary query (list).
Patient identity is key to successful operation of the EHR.
A bare identifier exposes the patient to potential privacy violation.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action. The association is optional because in some jurisdictions, the supervisor may be conveyed by he authentication token.
If AuthorizationToken not specified, association is mandatory. If AuthorizationToken specified, association is mandatory if authorization does not cover this participation.
This is the list of clinical and business issues that have been detected and/or managed involving the current action.
Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.
Indicates the item(s) being acted upon by this trigger event.
Will be mandatory in wrappers with payload messages, otherwise not present.

If true, associations in the parent act are conducted across the ActRelationship to the message payload (act). Conduction for each association is specifically indicated by each associations' contextControlCode value.

In other words, if the "subject" act relationship has contextConductionInd=true; THEN the dataEnterer association is carried according to the dataEnterer.contextControlCode (propogate to the payload and add to any data enterer(s) already present in the payload).
If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.
Provides information about the thing being created, modified or removed.
Indicates whether or not objects of the trigger event are to be cascaded to the payload.

If true, associations in the parent act are conducted across the ActRelationship to the message payload (act). Conduction for each association is specifically indicated by each associations' contextControlCode value.

In other words, if the "subject" act relationship has contextConductionInd=true; THEN the dataEnterer association is carried (to the payload) according to the dataEnterer.contextControlCode (AP = propogate to the payload and add to any data enterer(s) already present in the payload).
Cascading of trigger event objects allows different messages to employ consistent and common objects.
Attribute is mandatory to ensure that cascading will be specified one way or another.
On ‘creation’ interactions where the state transition is null->active, contextConductionInd must be true, otherwise it must be false.
Information pertaining to a patient's agreement/acceptance to have his/her clinical information electronically stored and shared.

This will usually only be populated for queries, but could be used for updates if a jurisdiction requires consent before recording information in the EHR (e.g. consent to participate in electronic data exchange).
Note: keywords canot be passed from one application to another via the EHR (e.g. prescriber to dispenser via a Drug Information System).
Provides authorization to record and/or view patient information.

Indicates the consent or keyword used to authorize access or update, including a reason for access; May also be used to override access restriction to the information ('break the glass') on a message by message basis.
May be required on a Prescription Request to indicate a keyword for drug utilization processing.

This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.
Describes the status of the control act, which is always complete (it happened).
Required for completeness of specification.
Indicates the time the event (e.g. query, change, activation) should begin and occasionally when it should end.

The time an event becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded (i.e. it may be in the future or the past). For events such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.
Identifies why this specific message interaction (e.g. query, activation request, modification request) occurred.
The domain associated with this attribute will vary for each interaction and will be noted as part of the interaction description.
Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold' or 'reason for accessing information'.

Associated patient record for which this message applies. Record target can be one of either identified patient (id, name, gender, date of birth), indeterminate patient (name, gender, date of birth) or a patient token (suggesting client identity).

Inferring patient identity opens up the potential for privacy breach through the mis-keying of identifiers. Also, inclusion of patient identity simplifies logging, processing and application of data access constraints such as masking and consent. Finally, patient id is required to support both EHR Index (record and update) and Patient Profile Summary query (list).
Patient identity is key to successful operation of the EHR.
A bare identifier exposes the patient to potential privacy violation.
Specific wrappers will implement one of the IssueEvent CMETs. In other words, the Choice Box will not be present in individual wrappers derived from this model.
Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.
Indicates the item(s) being acted upon by this trigger event.
Will be mandatory in wrappers with payload messages, otherwise not present.
If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.
Provides information about the thing being created, modified or removed.
Indicates whether or not objects of the trigger event are to be cascaded to the payload.

If true, associations in the parent act are conducted across the ActRelationship to the message payload (act). Conduction for each association is specifically indicated by each associations' contextControlCode value.

In other words, if the "subject" act relationship has contextConductionInd=true; THEN the subjectOf association is carried (to the payload) according to the subjectOf.contextControlCode (AP = propogate to the payload and add to any subject(s) (issues) already present in the payload).
Cascading of trigger event objects allows different messages to employ consistent and common objects.
Attribute is mandatory to ensure that cascading will be specified one way or another.
On ‘creation’ interactions where the state transition is null->active, contextConductionInd must be true, otherwise it must be false.

packageLocation.name: MCAI_MT700220CA
packageLocation.desc: Event Response Wrapper - Human Initiated Patient Specific With Clinical Act Payload

documentation.p: Indicates the person responsible for the event that caused this message.
Choice of Patient CMET is as follows:
1. 'identified' when supporting Patient Session Tokens.
2. 'informational' when passing through non Client- Registry patient for PHS or similar processing.
3. 'identified-confirmable' otherwise.
Critical for auditing and for validating permissions and therefore mandatory.
Value should always be AUT

The time the person responsible for the event made the decision for it to occur. This may be different than the time the change became effective. (E.g. If a provider decides today to put a prescription on hold starting next Tuesday, the time of creation would be today and the change effective period would be next Tuesday.)
This date can be back-dated.
The time a change is made is a critical piece of audit information and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates how the person who recorded the event became aware of it.. E.g. Verbal, written, fax, etc.
May have ramifications for the audit trail and reliability of the information.
Indicates the formal digital signature of the message content.
Digital signatures may be needed for authentication of message content. The attribute is marked as optional because it is not yet clear whether there is a use-case for this, or where it will be used.

This is a messaging artifact used by HL7 to allow the time, signiture and method to be captured when the author is not sent. This will happen in circumstances where the author information is sent as part of the authentication token.
Conveys an authentication token associated with the event.
The token may represent one or all of the following concepts: author, dataEnterer, responsibleParty, location and dataEntryLocation.
Conveys information related to the individuals and/or locations involved with the action in situations where the authentication happens on a one-time basis rather than on a per-message basis.
An authorization token expressed as a GUID.
The Authorization token may represent the concepts of author, data enterer, supervisor (responsible party), responsible location and/or data entry location.
GUIDs are an effective way of conveying a temporary authentication token
An authentication token expressed as a non-GUID string.
The Authorization token may represent the concepts of author, data enterer, supervisor (responsible party), responsible location and/or data entry location.
Some systems may choose to use a hashcode or other approach to token construction.
Identifies the action that resulted in this message being sent.
There may be constraints on the usage of the effectiveTime and reasonCode attributes in the definition of the interaction or the trigger events which are conveyed with this wrapper.
Key to understanding what action a message represents.
A unique identifier for this particular event assigned by the system in which the event occurred.
Identifier needs to be persisted by receiving applications, except for queries (queries cannot be retracted or undone).
Allows the event to be referenced (for undos) and also indicates whether multiple interactions were caused by the same triggering event. Also used for audit purposes.
Identifies the trigger event that occurred.
This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.
Describes the status of the control act, which is always complete (it happened).
Required for completeness of specification.
Indicates the time the event (e.g. query, change, activation) should begin and occasionally when it should end.

The time an event becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded (i.e. it may be in the future or the past). For events such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.
Identifies why this specific message interaction (e.g. query, activation request, modification request) occurred.
The domain associated with this attribute will vary for each interaction and will be noted as part of the interaction description.
Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold' or 'reason for accessing information'.

Indicates the person responsible for entering the query into the system. Used when different from the person responsible for the request (author). For example, physician requests administrative assistant to print off a patient's medication profile.
This should only be specified if different from the author.
Important for audit information and determining permissions.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Indicates the location where the record of this event was entered.
This should only be specified if different from the location where the event was authored.
Indicates a potential location for written records, and may also be important for authentication purposes.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Indicates the service delivery location where the event occurred.
Indicates where paper records may be located, and may be important to determining authorization.
The association is optional because in some jurisdictions this information will be conveyed as part of the authentication token.
Identifies the authentication token that references information about the people and/or places responsible for the event.
Some systems perform centralized authentication of providers and/or locations. The association is optional because not all systems will make use of a token-based authentication process.

Associated patient record for which this message applies. Record target can be one of either identified patient (id, name, gender, date of birth), indeterminate patient (name, gender, date of birth) or a patient token (suggesting client identity).

Inferring patient identity opens up the potential for privacy breach through the mis-keying of identifiers. Also, inclusion of patient identity simplifies logging, processing and application of data access constraints such as masking and consent. Finally, patient id is required to support both EHR Index (record and update) and Patient Profile Summary query (list).
Patient identity is key to successful operation of the EHR.
A bare identifier exposes the patient to potential privacy violation.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action. The association is optional because in some jurisdictions, the supervisor may be conveyed by he authentication token.
If AuthorizationToken not specified, association is mandatory. If AuthorizationToken specified, association is mandatory if authorization does not cover this participation.
Specific wrappers will implement one of the IssueEvent CMETs. In other words, the Choice Box will not be present in individual wrappers derived from this model.
Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.

Will be mandatory in wrappers with payload messages, otherwise not present.
If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.
Provides information about the thing being created, modified or removed.
Indicates whether or not objects of the trigger event are to be cascaded to the payload.

If true, associations in the parent act are conducted across the ActRelationship to the message payload (act). Conduction for each association is specifically indicated by each associations' contextControlCode value.

In other words, if the "subject" act relationship has contextConductionInd=true; THEN the dataEnterer association is carried (to the payload) according to the dataEnterer.contextControlCode (AP = propogate to the payload and add to any data enterer(s) already present in the payload).

Attribute is mandatory to ensure that cascading will be specified one way or another.

Patient identity is key to successful operation of the EHR.
A bare identifier exposes the patient to potential privacy violation.
Specific wrappers will implement one of the IssueEvent CMETs. In other words, the Choice Box will not be present in individual wrappers derived from this model.
Any trigger event can result in errors or may allow for errors to be overridden or managed.
Indicates the item(s) being acted upon by this trigger event.
Will be mandatory in wrappers with payload messages, otherwise not present.
If there are multiple subject items, the changes to all of them must be either accepted or rejected as a single action. I.e. One trigger event = 1 unit of work.
Provides information about the thing being created, modified or removed.
Indicates whether or not objects of the trigger event are to be cascaded to the payload.

If true, associations in the parent act are conducted across the ActRelationship to the message payload (act). Conduction for each association is specifically indicated by each associations' contextControlCode value.

In other words, if the "subject" act relationship has contextConductionInd=true; THEN the subjectOf association is carried (to the payload) according to the subjectOf.contextControlCode (AP = propogate to the payload and add to any subject(s) (issues) already present in the payload).
Cascading of trigger event objects allows different messages to employ consistent and common objects.
Attribute is mandatory to ensure that cascading will be specified one way or another.
On ‘creation’ interactions where the state transition is null->active, contextConductionInd must be true, otherwise it must be false.

packageLocation.name: MCAI_MT700227CA
packageLocation.desc: Event Response Wrapper - Device Initiated Patient Specific With Administrative Act Payload

documentation.p: Identifies the action that resulted in this message being sent.
There may be constraints on the usage of the effectiveTime and reasonCode attributes in the definition of the interaction or the trigger events which are conveyed with this wrapper.
Key to understanding what action a message represents.
A unique identifier for this particular event assigned by the system in which the event occurred.
Identifier needs to be persisted by receiving applications, except for queries (queries cannot be retracted or undone).
Allows the event to be referenced (for undos) and also indicates whether multiple interactions were caused by the same triggering event. Also used for audit purposes.
Identifies the trigger event that occurred.
This is mandatory because it is essential to understanding the meaning of the event.
Describes the status of the control act, which is always complete (it happened).
Required for completeness of specification.
Indicates the time the event (e.g. query, change, activation) should begin and occasionally when it should end.

The time an event becomes effective may differ from the time the event is recorded (i.e. it may be in the future or the past). For events such as 'suspend', an intended end date may also be indicated.
Identifies why this specific message interaction (e.g. query, activation request, modification request) occurred.
The domain associated with this attribute will vary for each interaction and will be noted as part of the interaction description.
Allows identifying a reason for a specific action, such as 'reason for hold' or 'reason for accessing information'.

Associated patient record for which this message applies. Record target can be one of either identified patient (id, name, gender, date of birth), indeterminate patient (name, gender, date of birth) or a patient token (suggesting client identity).

Inferring patient identity opens up the potential for privacy breach through the mis-keying of identifiers. Also, inclusion of patient identity simplifies logging, processing and application of data access constraints such as masking and consent. Finally, patient id is required to support both EHR Index (record and update) and Patient Profile Summary query (list).
Patient identity is key to successful operation of the EHR.
A bare identifier exposes the patient to potential privacy violation.
